battery.description: Provides information about the internal battery of a Macbook.

columns.description: Name of the key to search for

columns.description: Name of the registry value entry

columns.description: Type of the registry value, or 'subkey' if item is a subkey

examples: select path, key, name from registry where key = 'HKEY_USERS'; -- get user SIDS. Note: path is key+name
select path from registry where key like 'HKEY_USERS\.Default\%'; -- a SQL wildcard match; will not recurse subkeys
select path from registry where key like 'HKEY_USERS\.Default\Software\%%'; -- recursing query (compare with 1 %)
select path from registry where key like 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Micr%ft\%' and type = 'subkey' LIMIT 10; -- midfix wildcard match

select name, type, data from registry where path like 'HKEY_USERS\%\Control Panel\International\User Profile\Languages'; -- get users' current UI language. Note: osquery cannot reference HKEY_CURRENT_USER
select name, type, data from registry where path like 'HKEY_USERS\%\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\Wallpapers\%';  -- list all of the desktop wallpapers
select name, type, data from registry where key like 'HKEY_USERS\%\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\Wallpapers'; -- same, but filtering by key instead of path

scheduled_tasks.name: scheduled_tasks
scheduled_tasks.description: Lists all of the tasks in the Windows task scheduler.

columns.name: action
columns.description: Actions executed by the scheduled task

columns.name: path
columns.description: Path to the executable to be run

columns.name: enabled
columns.description: Whether or not the scheduled task is enabled

columns.name: hidden
columns.description: Whether or not the task is visible in the UI

columns.name: next_run_time
columns.description: Timestamp the task is scheduled to run next

columns.name: last_run_message
columns.description: Exit status message of the last task run

columns.name: last_run_code
columns.description: Exit status code of the last task run

examples: select * from scheduled_tasks where hidden=1 and enabled=1

services.name: services
services.description: Lists all installed Windows services and their relevant data.

columns.name: service_type
columns.description: Service Type: OWN_PROCESS, SHARE_PROCESS and maybe Interactive (can interact with the desktop)

columns.name: status
columns.description: Service Current status: STOPPED, START_PENDING, STOP_PENDING, RUNNING, CONTINUE_PENDING, PAUSE_PENDING, PAUSED

columns.name: pid
columns.description: the Process ID of the service

columns.name: start_type
columns.description: Service start type: BOOT_START, SYSTEM_START, AUTO_START, DEMAND_START, DISABLED

columns.name: win32_exit_code
columns.description: The error code that the service uses to report an error that occurs when it is starting or stopping

columns.name: service_exit_code
columns.description: The service-specific error code that the service returns when an error occurs while the service is starting or stopping

columns.name: user_account
columns.description: The name of the account that the service process will be logged on as when it runs. This name can be of the form Domain\UserName. If the account belongs to the built-in domain, the name can be of the form .\UserName.

shared_resources.name: shared_resources
shared_resources.description: Displays shared resources on a computer system running Windows. This may be a disk drive, printer, interprocess communication, or other sharable device.

columns.name: description
columns.description: A textual description of the object

columns.name: install_date
columns.description: Indicates when the object was installed. Lack of a value does not indicate that the object is not installed.

columns.name: status
columns.description: String that indicates the current status of the object.

columns.name: allow_maximum
columns.description: Number of concurrent users for this resource has been limited. If True, the value in the MaximumAllowed property is ignored.

columns.name: maximum_allowed
columns.description: Limit on the maximum number of users allowed to use this resource concurrently. The value is only valid if the AllowMaximum property is set to FALSE.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Alias given to a path set up as a share on a computer system running Windows.

columns.name: path
columns.description: Local path of the Windows share.

columns.name: type
columns.description: Type of resource being shared. Types include: disk drives, print queues, interprocess communications (IPC), and general devices.

video_info.name: video_info
video_info.description: Retrieve video card information of the machine.

columns.name: color_depth
columns.description: The amount of bits per pixel to represent color.

columns.name: driver_date
columns.description: The date listed on the installed driver.

columns.name: driver_version
columns.description: The version of the installed driver.

columns.name: video_mode
columns.description: The current resolution of the display.

winbaseobj.name: winbaseobj
winbaseobj.description: Lists named Windows objects in the default object directories, across all terminal services sessions.

windows_crashes.name: windows_crashes
windows_crashes.description: Extracted information from Windows crash logs (Minidumps).

columns.name: module
columns.description: Path of the crashed module within the process

columns.name: path
columns.description: Path of the executable file for the crashed process

columns.name: pid
columns.description: Process ID of the crashed process

columns.name: tid
columns.description: Thread ID of the crashed thread

columns.name: version
columns.description: File version info of the crashed process

columns.name: process_uptime
columns.description: Uptime of the process in seconds

columns.name: stack_trace
columns.description: Multiple stack frames from the stack trace

columns.name: exception_message
columns.description: The NTSTATUS error message associated with the exception code

columns.name: exception_address
columns.description: Address (in hex) where the exception occurred

columns.name: registers
columns.description: The values of the system registers

columns.name: command_line
columns.description: Command-line string passed to the crashed process

columns.name: current_directory
columns.description: Current working directory of the crashed process

columns.name: username
columns.description: Username of the user who ran the crashed process

columns.name: machine_name
columns.description: Name of the machine where the crash happened

columns.name: major_version
columns.description: Windows major version of the machine

columns.name: minor_version
columns.description: Windows minor version of the machine

columns.name: build_number
columns.description: Windows build number of the crashing machine

examples: select * from windows_crashes where module like '%electron.exe%'
select * from windows_crashes where registers like '%rax=0000000000000004%'
select * from windows_crashes where stack_trace like '%vlc%'

windows_events.name: windows_events

columns.name: datetime
columns.description: System time at which the event occurred

columns.name: source
columns.description: Source or channel of the event

columns.name: task
columns.description: Task value associated with the event

columns.name: level
columns.description: The severity level associated with the event

columns.name: keywords
columns.description: A bitmask of the keywords defined in the event

examples: select * from windows_events where eventid=4104 and channel='Security'

wmi_bios_info.name: wmi_bios_info
wmi_bios_info.description: Lists important information from the system bios.

wmi_cli_event_consumers.name: wmi_cli_event_consumers
wmi_cli_event_consumers.description: WMI CommandLineEventConsumer, which can be used for persistence on Windows. See https://www.blackhat.com/docs/us-15/materials/us-15-Graeber-Abusing-Windows-Management-Instrumentation-WMI-To-Build-A-Persistent%20Asynchronous-And-Fileless-Backdoor-wp.pdf for more details.

columns.name: command_line_template
columns.description: Standard string template that specifies the process to be started. This property can be NULL, and the ExecutablePath property is used as the command line.

columns.name: executable_path
columns.description: Module to execute. The string can specify the full path and file name of the module to execute, or it can specify a partial name. If a partial name is specified, the current drive and current directory are assumed.

columns.name: relative_path
columns.description: Relative path to the class or instance.

examples: select filter,consumer,query,command_line_template,wcec.name from wmi_cli_event_consumers wcec left outer join wmi_filter_consumer_binding wcb on consumer = wcec.relative_path left outer join wmi_event_filters wef on wef.relative_path = wcb.filter;

columns.name: name
columns.description: Unique identifier of an event filter.

columns.name: query
columns.description: Windows Management Instrumentation Query Language (WQL) event query that specifies the set of events for consumer notification, and the specific conditions for notification.

columns.name: query_language
columns.description: Query language that the query is written in.

columns.name: relative_path
columns.description: Relative path to the class or instance.

wmi_filter_consumer_binding.name: wmi_filter_consumer_binding
wmi_filter_consumer_binding.description: Lists the relationship between event consumers and filters.

columns.name: consumer
columns.description: Reference to an instance of __EventConsumer that represents the object path to a logical consumer, the recipient of an event.

columns.name: filter
columns.description: Reference to an instance of __EventFilter that represents the object path to an event filter which is a query that specifies the type of event to be received.

columns.name: relative_path
columns.description: Relative path to the class or instance.

wmi_script_event_consumers.name: wmi_script_event_consumers
wmi_script_event_consumers.description: WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumer, which can be used for persistence on Windows. See https://www.blackhat.com/docs/us-15/materials/us-15-Graeber-Abusing-Windows-Management-Instrumentation-WMI-To-Build-A-Persistent%20Asynchronous-And-Fileless-Backdoor-wp.pdf for more details.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Unique identifier for the event consumer.

columns.name: scripting_engine
columns.description: Name of the scripting engine to use, for example, 'VBScript'. This property cannot be NULL.

columns.name: script_file_name
columns.description: Name of the file from which the script text is read, intended as an alternative to specifying the text of the script in the ScriptText property.

columns.name: script_text
columns.description: Text of the script that is expressed in a language known to the scripting engine. This property must be NULL if the ScriptFileName property is not NULL.

columns.name: relative_path
columns.description: Relative path to the class or instance.

examples: select filter,consumer,query,scripting_engine,script_file_name,script_text,wsec.name from wmi_script_event_consumers wsec left outer join wmi_filter_consumer_binding wcb on consumer = wsec.relative_path left outer join wmi_event_filters wef on wef.relative_path = wcb.filter;

yara.name: yara
yara.description: Track YARA matches for files or PIDs.
examples: select * from yara where path LIKE '/etc/%'
select * from yara where path = '/etc/passwd' and sigfile = '/etc/osquery/yara/test.yara'

yara_events.name: yara_events
yara_events.description: Track YARA matches for files specified in configuration data.
